description:
9/21/2022 – at approximately 12:55 p.m. at the intersection of NE Cornell Road and NE Elam Young Parkway.
 Weather  was clear  and the pavement surface was dry .  
 This crash was  a motorcycle versus v ehicle  crash where serious i njuries  were  reported.  
 
 The motorcyclist was traveling on a green light, east bound on NE Cornell Road  at what witnesses 
stated as normal speed. The vehicle was in the westbound turn lane on NE Cornell attempting to travel 
south on NE Elam Young Parkway. The motorcyclist impacted the vehicle when the vehicle attempted a 
left turn against the light.  
 The driver of the vehicle was cited  for: no driver’s license and failure to obey a traffic control device.   
 Staff did not visit the location .

10/2/2022 – at 8:20 p.m. at  the intersection of NW 273 rd Avenue and NE Evergreen Road.
 Weather was clear and the pavement surface was dry.  
 This crash involved a single vehicle which rolled over several times and resulted in serious injuries  for 
both the driver and passenger . 
 Several witnesses stated the vehicle had been observed exceeding the speed limit, swerving , and 
hitting medians at several locations before the vehicle lost control and rolled multiple times ending up 
in a field.   The report does not indicate whether  the driver was cited . 
 
Excessive speed appeared to be a factor is this crash . Intoxicants may have also  contributed to this 
crash . Public Works staff did not visit the crash location.

10/3/2022 – at around 4:25 p.m. at the intersection of NE Cornelius Pass Road and E Main Street.   
 
Weather  was clear and the pavement surface was dry  
 This crash involved a vehicle versus a scooter  with minor  injuries . 
 The scooter  was travelling west bound on the sidewalk and rode into a vehicle as a vehicle was leaving 
the intersection. Driver stated that he was creeping forward on a red light ; when he received a green 
light he proceeded forward, this is when he impacted the scooter. Witnesses confirmed this statement.    
   
This is a signalized intersection. It’s unclear why the scooter user did not use the pedestrian activated 
button at this intersection. Staff did not visit the location.  
 
No citations were issued.

10/15/2022 – at around 11:13 p.m. at the intersection of SE 10th Avenue and just south of SE Clipper Lane. (near 
Carl’s Jr.)   
Weather was clear and the pavement surface was dry   
  
This crash involved a vehicle versus a pedestrian with fatal injuries.  
 The pedestrian was observed running from east to west across SE 10
th. A vehicle was travelling 
southbound on SE 10th at about 30 mph when they impacted the pedestrian.  
The driver remained on scene, was cooperative, and was not impaired.  
Due to the emotional state of the driver, it was unclear if the driver briefly saw the pedestrian and was 
unable to stop in time or if they did not react until after the impact.      
   
This crash occurred outside a crosswalk and in poor lighting conditions  (night) . Staff did not visit the 
location.
